review.reviewBody: Excellent boots. Works well in mud, snow and rainy weather!
review.name: Love These Boots!

review.reviewBody: I have bogs from some years ago and they fit very well and worked great. These new ones were supposedly the same size but they turn out to be a lot smaller, not comfortable at all. Will be returning.
review.name: Not made with the same quality as years back

review.reviewBody: This is the third pair of Bogs that I have owned. Best boot ever. I use them for wet weather, hunting and all winter use. I tell my friends they should get them.
review.name: Comfortable and durable.

review.reviewBody: I purchased a pair ten years ago and they are still holding up - great for garden, yard and snow work! Easy to slide on and off!
review.name: Going on 10 years now!

review.reviewBody: Haven't had any snow yet, but they seem sturdy and fit well.
review.name: Comfortable and sturdy

review.reviewBody: GREAT! I wore out my last pair and these are the BEST
review.name: THE BEST!

review.reviewBody: I have not worn these ones much yet. These are to replace the same pair I bought six years ago. I'm replacing the old ones because they are showing signs of wear after six years of abuse in mud, creeks, and 10 to 12 mile days in wet forests (they are still dry and comfortable). Anytime it rains or I will be in mud and muc, I pull on the bogs. These are not my everyday steel toe leather boot, but when it's wet I'm sure glad I have them.
review.name: Best rain boot I have found.

review.reviewBody: Had to order a size 15 shoe to be able to put them on easily. Fit like a glove.
review.name: Might need to order oversized shoe if you have big feet

review.reviewBody: Love these boots. Noticed a slight change in how the toes are pushed forward and the area around the base of the toes is tight. It is right behind the toe cap.
review.name: Great boot

review.reviewBody: We have been bog customers for years. My 12 year old son has graduated from kid sizes to adult. He seems happy with his men size boots. They are easy on and off and they keep our feet dry. I suggest adding a thicker wool sock for the winter months because our feet get cold long before the boots are technically rated to.
review.name: We love bogs!

name: Ultra Mid Boot - Men's

description: Buy the KEEN Puffrider WP Boot - Kids' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Puffrider WP Boot - Kids'
hasVariant.description: Buy the KEEN Puffrider WP Boot - Kids' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my 6 and 8 year old. Both liked the boots through the winter. no complaints of cold feet. My only complaint is the coating on the boots flaked off. The quality was a bit under what I would expect from Keene. Unfortunately Keene only has a 30 day guarantee. These boots should be guaranteed for craftsmanship.
review.name: Nice boots, but coating flaking off.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the look of these. We love that it doesn't have that sock/boot/inner that would create and extra step for my kids. We love that Keen runs wider, especially around the toes and that it has that toe guard as well. The fabric used for the insoles is my only concern. We only have had a couple days of snow and my kids used these for about a week so far and there is already lint build up from their feet rubbing on the insole fabric. My son is a bit sensory and feels bothered by the bumpy texture that has already formed. I'm sure thicker socks will help!
review.name: Warm and spacious

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the look of these. We love that it doesn't have that sock/boot/inner that would create and extra step for my kids. We love that Keen runs wider, especially around the toes and that it has that toe guard as well. The fabric used for the insoles is my only concern. We only have had a couple days of snow and my kids used these for about a week so far and there is already lint build up from their feet rubbing on the insole fabric. My son is a bit sensory and feels bothered by the bumpy texture that has already formed. I'm sure thicker socks will help!
review.name: Warm and spacious

review.reviewBody: Easy on/off. I expected a bit more insulation given that they are based in NH. We will see how it goes with the kids' toes!
review.name: Good

review.reviewBody: Absolutely awful. My child has worn these for less than a month and they are peeling, fraying, and have lost their shape.
review.name: Donâ€™t waste your money

name: Puffrider WP Boot - Kids'

hasVariant.description: Buy the Pirelli P Zero Race Clincher Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: P Zero Race Clincher Tire
hasVariant.description: Buy the Pirelli P Zero Race Clincher Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have not yet made the jump to tubeless, and have run Conti Grand Prix for 30 years prior to this. The latest TLR models are impossible to get on/off my HED or Zipp rims, so I switched to Pirelli's. After well over a year, in all conditions, and multiple sets, these feel fast and have excellent grip. Mileage has been very good (not quite as good as my last GP5000s), and while they seem quite durable on our typical trash roadways, it always feels like they aren't quite the Conti's I had before, and therefore 4 stars.  Yes, they cost a bit more, also, but I'm willing to pay that to be able to get them on/off the rim without worrying about either damaging another carbon rim, or having to cut the tire.  
I also love the 26 size, since my bike will not fit 28's.
review.name: Fast, durable, and easy to mount/remove

name: P Zero Race Clincher Tire

review.itemreviewed: Delta Ridge II Down Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's been a very long time since I owned a down jacket. This is the duck down version and I like the pattern better than the synthetic version. This jacket is thin, not bulky but warm! I have worn it in the low 20's and I am nice and warm. I am 6'3", 44 ish chest and got the XL. It's a bit roomy but I was afraid the L would be too tight with a mid layer.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Simms Flyweight Vest online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This could have been the perfect best but, needs another 2-3 external pockets and at least one internal.
A great shame because otherwise it ticks all the boxesâ€¦.
review.name: Good but, no cigar

review.reviewBody: I am a Simms fanboy and had high hopes for this vest. The back array of pockets is excellent and exactly what I wanted. Unfortunately,  the front pockets turned out to be a disapointment. Previous Simms vests I've owned had clever pocket arrays, but here I had to place multiple items in the few pockets available.  On the river, I had valuable items spilling into the river never to be seen again. Hoping Simms will go back and rethink this potentially excellent product.
review.name: Not quite

review.reviewBody: I am a Simms fanboy and had high hopes for this vest. The back compartments are excellent, but unfortunately, the front pockets are too basic and not functional. I was forced to stuff multiple items into single pockets that made it awkward to use on the river. The end result was valuable items spilling unexpectedly into a fast flowing river and lost forever.
review.name: Adequate but not perfect

review.reviewBody: I normally use a waist pack and donâ€™t want to be wrapped in a heavy vest. A lot of my fishing is in the eastern mountains and requires some hiking. I purchased the vest AND the similar vest pack. I like the overall design and fit very much. I also like the options for managing a net. Iâ€™m disappointed in the details. The trim around the rear closure, the black tape, is starting to peel up. The elastic strings on both sides are awkward and in the way. Iâ€™m tempted to cut them off. I like to slip my tippet into an accessible pocket, but neither outer pocket is wide enough. There was a missed opportunity for elastic outer pockets on the lower pockets in the front. It would also benefit from a few loops sewn into the seams along front center for attaching tools or other things. I like the concept. Itâ€™s pretty fair. The quality and design elements fall a little short.
review.name: Great Idea No Quite Fully Executed

review.reviewBody: The back of this vest is absolutely perfect. A place for your net, plenty of water, a raincoat, your lunch. What happened with the front? It was 4:30 and everyone was ready to go home?  Just throw a couple pockets on it and letâ€™s go? Simms almost hit a home run with this one. A couple d-rings and an inside pocket away from being the perfect vest.
review.name: Almost nailed it

name: Flyweight Vest

hasVariant.description: Buy the Redshift Sports ShockStop Suspension Stem online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have a TBI and it was getting hard to ride from all the jolting on lousy California roads. My riding partner told me about Redshift sports stem and I looked it up and ended up purchasing. I installed it as soon as I received it and what a difference. It didnt take all of the road vibration away but enough that I can ride 20 to 25 miles without needing to stop and rest my poor brain.
review.name: I can ride again

review.reviewBody: Most of my rides are a mix of pavement, gravel, and a small bit of single track with larger rocks and roots.  My bike is a Carver All-Road gravel bike, which does not have suspension components.  I use an alt handlebar, which is supposedly less optimal than drop bars when it comes to initiating travel in the stem.  I am a larger rider, 230lbs, which likely offsets some of that geometry challenge.  The Redshift stem provides much needed "give" for the bike's front end.  The company advertises 20mm of compliance and I believe that to be a true figure.  You don't notice the stem "travel" on most surfaces, but my shoulders sure figured out something was going on to improve ride quality.  My worst case scenario, washboard gravel, is more bearable with the Redshift stem.  The stem would clearly be overmatched with true mountain bike terrain, but for gravel riding it noticeably improves ride quality.  Setup was relatively easy.  I made the mistake of going too firm with my elastomer choices on my first attempt.  Swapping out elastomers for a softer setting made a huge difference and the bars are still plenty stiff on pavement.  I installed the +30 stem, which might be a little too much rise.  A choice of a +20 stem would be nice to have.  All in all, I believe the RS stem is worth the added costs.
review.name: Simple and Effective

review.reviewBody: I purchased this to reduce vibration soreness to my left wrist which has arthritis. It has worked wonderfully.  A slight downside is that I canâ€™t pull as much on my handlebars when pushing hard- the upside is that I find I am really working my legs more, which is exactly why Iâ€™m out there anyway!
review.name: Helps my wrists on gravel rides

review.reviewBody: This did exactly what I was looking for ? reduce uncomfortable, fatiguing shocks through the handlebars while keeping the sure-footed compliance.   A month ago I purchased a new bike and knew I wanted to take it on and off road.  I did not want a fully suspended bike, but rather something to absorb those shocks from potholes, rocks, sharp transitions.  On my motorcycle I had found bars with elastomer absorbers, so I set out hoping the same existed for my gravel bike.  When I came across this stem from redshift, it seemed to tick the boxes.  I bought it to test and have never looked back.  Riding around LA our streets arent always in the best shape.  This has been amazing.  Not soft but a firm shock absorber.  I've got about 400 miles on it so far and have recommeded to many others.  It is worth experimenting with the various elastomer inserts.  I ended up going with a little softer than recommended and it works for me.  I used the same geometry as my original stem to maintain riding position ? a colleague opted for the higher version as he was looking for a more upright riding posture.  I have since also purchased their shockstoper seat post.  together they have made my riding more comfortable, less painful and therefore allowing me to go a little further and on more challenging surfaces.
review.name: A great addition to my gravel bike

review.reviewBody: I have put about 500-600 miles on this shock over the last month. Riding both road and single track and I really dont feel it when I ride which i like as I dont feel like it impacts my energy transfer very much at all. I am sure it does but minimally as I have installed the stiffer polymers (not the factory default). On long rides (50+ miles) my shoulders dont get sore which they still do on my other road bike also I can defintley ride faster over rough patches. I am setting PR's all the time while feeling better after my rides. It was dead easy to install. Stats: I ride a roughly 3-4K miles a year, 6"2' tall 210 and I am almost 60 so not out to kill it but i do ride hard. This is mounted on my Trek Checkpoint 6. I like it a lot!
review.name: Redshift Stem Shock

review.reviewBody: My husband bought this for me and what a life changer it is!! We put this on my Sirrus X 3.0 Gravel Bike. It really takes the edge off. I find that I can ride longer with comfort and less fatigue.
review.name: Shock Stop Suspension Stem

review.reviewBody: like most people i was suspicious of how useful this would be. after my first ride im totally sold. this changes the game when it comes to gravel riding. highly recommend to anyone looking to smooth out the rough stuff.
review.name: not a gimmick..

review.reviewBody: It took me two years to finally pull the trigger on buying this and I wish I?d done it sooner. I have two buddies who?ve had it since it first came out and both swear by it so I should taken their advice immediately. It makes a huge difference even though you don?t really notice the stem moving except on the biggest hits. It makes my arms, shoulders, neck and lower back feel a lot fresher than normal after a long gravel ride. It softens the chatter and pounding making it feel like I?m running larger-volume tires at a lower PSI. I had to flip my stem which required some moving around of the elastomers but it was easy even for a mechanically challenged fool like myself. Go ahead and buy this. It?s well worth the money.
review.name: it really works

review.reviewBody: I read/watched a lot of reviews before purchasing but I was still skeptical. However the redshift stem works just like it?s supposed to, it softens the ride without feeling like you have a bouncy stem. Most of the time you don?t notice it at all, but on rough gravel roads you will notice a slight flex. What you?ll really notice however is how much better your hands and shoulders feel after long rides on tough roads.
review.name: As good as advertised

review.reviewBody: I got this stem for a carbon fiber hybrid bike. The rough roads had really been playing havoc with my hands. I installed the stem and took it out for a ride, it  amazingly improved ride. I put in the 60 and 50 shims and really felt very little wiggle or give.  The road damage no longer was unpleasant and it rode very well at all speeds and conditions
review.name: A lot cheaper than a new front fork

name: ShockStop Suspension Stem

review.reviewBody: I deeply regret not returning them as soon as I realized how slippery they are on hard surfaces when the soles are wet. I came in last night out of the rain and slipped off the top step of a two-step down into my concrete floored laundry room and whacked my head on the top step when I landed. Not cool. I have never slipped on this step before. These shoes are EXTREMELY slick when wet on hard surfaces.
review.name: Dangerously slippery when wet!

review.reviewBody: Super cute light weight pants! I got a size small. The waistband is bigger than I would like. I have to have it tightened as much as it will go. Wish I sized down!
review.name: Size down

review.reviewBody: These are so cute. Unfortunately the size I ordered was too big for me so I had to return. Fwiw, Iâ€™m 5â€™2â€ & approx. 130# & I ordered a M. They may be a little long if youâ€™re on the petite side.
review.name: Great pant, wrong size

review.reviewBody: I love these pants! They are super comfortable and flexible and dry quickly. They are a fun color, are cute and to top it off have amazing pockets!!! I have worn them hiking on trails and waterfalls and rock climbing and they functioned beautifully. Great stretch. Great durability! Great breathability perfect adventure pants
review.name: Great for every adventure

review.reviewBody: These are breathable and comfortable for summer walks. Made the mistake of wearing them through on a hike where there were thorny bushes. It was a path where it wasn't as maintained as we hoped. My pants got snagged by a few and created tiny tears. Maybe not as rugged as it's described.
review.name: Breatheable but not meant for rough hike

review.reviewBody: These pants are so simple yet so fun. I got them in the Hydro/Cactus/Margarita color and am kind of obsessed. Very swishy slidey fabric, breathable and comfy. I'm a shorty and they go right to my ankles. I love that the pockets and spacious and lined with a soft fabric - it's the little things for me.
review.name: Awesome Activity Pants

review.reviewBody: These fit true to size. My only complaint is the light green side is kinda see through. Itâ€™s not horrible, but noticeable and do have to consider what underwear to wear with these pants.
review.name: I love these pants!

review.reviewBody: I have 4 pairs of these shorts! I usually prefer high rise in my bottoms - these are mid rise but are basically a high rise. They are super comfortable, dry quickly and I love the cuffed bottom part. Theyâ€™re made well and a good value. Highly recommend!
review.name: Perfect shorts for summer

review.reviewBody: They are ankel high i fold them up so they are even higher! I am 5.2 130lbs and got a small!! They are super cute and super comfortable!! Higly recommend
review.name: Love love love

review.reviewBody:
I got these pants in the blue/green split combo. I get tons of compliments and I absolutely love the color. Iâ€™m not a huge fan of the fabric, which feels like a plasticy type of material, but itâ€™s very breathable and easy to move in, which is what i bought them for. 

Iâ€™m 5â€™10, and finding pants long enough are always a challenge. these are a little short on me, but it isnâ€™t too bad. it just becomes noticeable when i sit down. 

overall, i really like this and would probably buy it in another color if i needed more pants
review.name: cute pants, bit short

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is just as pictured.  Bright colors and well made.  Itâ€™s a warm little Sherpa

review.itemreviewed: Zing III Fleece Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Have purchased Columbia products for all grandkids for 12 years. I am always pleased with the look and quality. This jacket is very colorful and will be used on a daily basis.
review.name: Columbia jackets exceed expectations

review.itemreviewed: Zing III Fleece Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wonderful gear, great price for the season, swift shipping, thanks a lot

review.itemreviewed: Zing III Fleece Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My son loves the print and it is the perfect light jacket. It is definitely good for layering under a winter coat if needed, but great on its own as well for cool mornings and evenings!
review.name: Great light jacket

review.itemreviewed: Zing III Fleece Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Very cute fleece-it will be a Christmas present this year
review.name: Cute buffalo fleece

review.itemreviewed: Zing III Fleece Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super soft fleece. Fits my toddler really well. Canâ€™t wait to the baby version on his baby brother arriving next month. Awesome print too!
review.name: Super soft, amazing colors!

review.itemreviewed: Zing III Fleece Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Perfect in every way--great colors and made verywell. We love these fleece! This is our second one-bought one two years ago for our son--they wear well and do not fade. We went with one size up and we get two winter seasons out of them. Our son loves this fleece!!!
review.name: Our Toddler Loves These!!!

review.itemreviewed: Zing III Fleece Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This fleece is a yearly staple for my family. We buy one for both of my boys every year. They wash/hold up well, the colors are great and they keep my kids warm. Gotta say, I love the new bright colors. (My kids instantly gravitated to the bright green/blue and the red/blue stripes.) They are used a lot. From an everyday medium jacket, mid layer under warmer jacket or rain shell, camping, hiking, anything outdoors really. As long as nothing changes I will continue to buy these and recommend them to all my mom friends, who now buy them for their kids too. Seriously... we are all walking around looking like a Columbia Ad lol! Thanks Columbia for making a great product.
review.name: Yearly staple

review.itemreviewed: Zing III Fleece Jacket - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have twins and had 1 of these for a previous son, so I bought a second so both twins could have one. They love it! It seems so warm and snug. One night , we got in late and one of them refused to take it off . He slept in it all night.
review.name: So adorable

name: Zing III Fleece Jacket - Toddler Boys'

review.reviewBody: I bought this for myself and find it to be about a half of size bigger than I would like. It fits true to size and is because I always have to size up for my hips. The pullover is soft and nice though with exactly what I was looking for with something like this, and although I have only worn it a couple of times, in line with OR quality.
review.name: Nice hoodie - high collar is really nice

review.reviewBody:
Perfect for running in the cold! 

...............
review.name: Perfect for cold runs!

review.reviewBody: Great color, warm but not too hot. Long, which is appreciated!
review.name: Excellent quality pullover

review.reviewBody:
I was hoping it was better. I love outdoor research because I find everything fits extra long in the arms. Which I need being so tall. This fleece fits odd, the sleeves arenâ€™t as long as other fleece Iâ€™ve bought from here and the seam under the chest area is high, so if your larger chested the seam rises up across and looks very odd. Iâ€™m glad I didnâ€™t pay full price for this product and wish I could return, but itâ€™s been worn and washed. Maybe if you average height it would work? 
It did keep me warm, I work outdoors in rain and it helped keep me cosy though.
review.name: Not sure about it

review.reviewBody: Purchased because of sale price but opinion is itâ€™s a solid buy at full price. Super soft, breathable and high warmth:weight ratio. Pullover & light t-shirt all I needed down to 50 F still and 40 F active. Washes great (hang dry). Stayed fresh 2 weeks light walking/hiking in Switzerland when worn over light t-shirt. Buying another color & itâ€™s my new go-to pullover for cool temp hiking!
review.name: Perfect Hiking Pullover!

review.reviewBody: This pullover is super soft and comfy. I love the thumbholes and the little pocket within the big pocket is perfect for keeping my phone from falling out. I've worn this pretty much every day since I received it.
review.name: super cozy!

review.reviewBody: This shirt is sooo nice I want it in every color! I'm usually a black/grey/navy gal, but I got the orange fizz and I'm so happy I did. I have gotten a ton of compliments and always feel cheerful when I put it on! The best part tho is this cut is perfect for my body. I'm a 5'8" XL (38C cup) with some extra tummy and was worried it would be too tight in the waist. I also find a lot of sleeves are too short or shoulders are tight. But this shirt fits like it was tailored to my body! I'm so appreciative of OR designing their clothing that is proportional for larger bodies instead of other outdoor brands that use S or M as a template and then just add inches. I also think the cut of this shirt would look great and be comfortable on anyone, regardless of size! It's also warm but temp regulating and has a neat mesh pocket so you don't loose keys and other small things.
review.name: Fits like a dream!

review.reviewBody: I have not used yet (in technical use terms). However, it is a perfect layer to thrown on in the early days of spring. Cozy, perfect fit (great for my long arms and torso), and love this colour (lots of compliments on it)
review.name: I would buy this again in all the colours!

review.reviewBody: My favourite go to sweater
review.name: Great fit and warm

review.reviewBody: It is warm and roomie - Most comfortable mid layer I own for colder days. Fits larger than I though so had to exchange for a smaller size
review.name: Comfie and Warm

review.reviewBody: I ordered a size 34" because I typically wear a 33" in other jeans, but these barely fit me. The sizing is so inaccurate that I will be returning them.
review.name: Inaccurate Sizing Leads to a Poor Fit

review.reviewBody:
I was very excited to get this trousers, one of the very few that are ventilated, light, aimed for hot weather and with minimal design and pockets (walking with stuff in cargo is not  recommended
). Unfortunately a seam on the front of the trousers between the thigh and the knee that causes discomfort when walking uphill or climbing stairs makes it a very poor choice for me. By manually reducing this thigh length of the trousers, the seam is then placed sufficiently above the knee and no longer causes discomfort. I am 1m73 tall, size 32 Regular. I wouldn't recommend this product for anyone under 1m75.    Without that seam, The trousers would probably be a 4 or 5 stars :-(
review.name: Seam causes strong disconfort just above the knee

review.reviewBody: I purchased this last month from an authorized retailer. I love the look, the fit, weight. I just had a fluke tumble and fall on a slippery grass this morning and tore a small hole on the knee, which I was very surprised to find, as it was NOT a hard fall, and there was hardly any jagged material that could have caused significant damage to the area. I haven't even taken them out to backcountry yet so I am a bit disappointed that it was so easily torn.
review.name: Could be tougher for backcountry use

review.reviewBody: If youâ€™re like me and dislike shorts, these are the pants for you.  I wear these when I canâ€™t wear my Vidda Pro  Liteâ€™s.  Anywhere from 80 degrees Fahrenheit and higher.  Perfection.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: I have multiple pairs of Fjallraven trousers and these have to be my favorite pair to date!
review.name: Fave new pair of pants!

review.reviewBody:
Plus: great color. Love the roll top magnetic closure and tough fabric on back and bottom. 
Minus: wish theyâ€™d put that tough fabric at bottom of side pockets. I see a tripod blowout in the future. The dangling drawstring on the back is a little obnoxious. The clever folks at PD could have done better with that. Itâ€™s a little expensive.
review.name: Mostly wonderful

review.reviewBody:
I just received mine about 3 weeks ago. Super happy with the design, build, colour and the quality. I love how it opens both ways and itâ€™s perfect for my camera and lenses! 

The compartments are really thought through. I canâ€™t wait to take it to more of my outdoor adventures!

Thanks Peak Design for this awesome design!
review.name: Outdoor 25L - Eclipse

review.reviewBody: Iâ€™m using mine as a work laptop bag, a bag for hiking & biking treks, and with a Smedium Camera bag as a full on camera bag with space for other stuff.  Super protection and easy to use.  Iâ€™d give it 5 stars but I think the price is high, especially since youâ€™re going to need accessories for lots of use cases.
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a cool backpack for outdoor use. This backpack is well thought out in terms of functionality and also looks cool. Personally, I really like the material.
review.name: The Fellowship of travel

review.reviewBody:
I backed this product in Kickstarter.
The quality is great, and most important thing for me is that the design is very unique and cool. There is no similar product in the market so I am really satisfied with it.
review.name: Great design!

review.reviewBody: Signed up to the Kickstarter campaign and did not regret. Bought this to replace my smaller commuting bag (PD Everyday 20L). Currently being used as a daily commute via train to work (in Sydney AU) to carry a 16" laptop and lunch (in a Decor Microsafe Oblong). Sits well with everything in it. Super flat when lunch is taken out. Very comfy shoulder straps (also sits well for my broad frame). Well worth investing into adjusting to the many compartments where you can store things. Will be tested and used for travelling next year!
review.name: Great commuter backpack

review.reviewBody: Extremely happy with the customizability and features of the backpack. Coupled with the premium materials, couldn't have picked a better backpack.
review.name: Perfect Hybrid EDC / Hiking Pack

review.reviewBody: I purchased this backpack to replace my daily computer schlepping backpack where the zippers blew out.  This lightweight pack accommodates my 16" Lenovo laptop, though not in the designated sleeve.  I can quickly load and unload the computer and store peripherals like a charger and mouse.  The backpack is well-constructed, very comfortable, and straightforward.  It gives me the capacity and flexibility I need without a lot of unnecessary pockets, dividers, and add-ons. This is the second Peak Design pack I've purchased, and like my previous travel backpack purchase, it is an excellent product.  From my experience, Peak Design makes well-thought-out, adaptable products that can be tailored to an individual's needs and preferences.  Highly recommended, even if a bit more costly than competitors!
review.name: Ease Of Access To Contents

name: Outdoor 25L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Teravail Rutland tires have ranked consistently as one of the top 10 gravel tires for many years now, and I've put hundreds of miles on these and would happily put them on another bike in a heartbeat. Grippy and supple, and different options give you light and supple or more protection when riding. I adore these tires, and they look incredible. True tire width is always affected by rim ID, but I've never thought these were too narrow for what I expected them to be.
review.name: One of the top ranked tires for a reason

review.reviewBody: I ordered the 700x42 tires and was shocked by how narrow they are. I know sizing for tire width varies across brands but something must be off with these. On the same rim, compared to a Bruce Gordon rock n' road tire, listed at 43 mm, the Rutland 42 is close to 1/4 narrower. It is also narrower than a Schwalbe G one 40 mm. These should really be reevaluated.
review.name: Much narrower than expected.

name: Rutland Tubeless Tire

hasVariant.description: Buy the Karakoram Prime Connect Split Kit 2.0 online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Gave it two stars because the system is quick and easy to transition.

Problem is these failed on my first day out. There are two screws that hold the tab for the heel cup stripped out when I initiated a toe side turn. 

The design does not allow the screws to back out, the bottom of the binding would prevent that. These screws pulled out of the metal on the pucks.  I attached a photo where you can see missing threads. 

I would understand if one screw somehow backed out or if they were loose after the end of the day. Truth is the screws blew out when I initiated a carve. 

Will not trust this system going into the backcountry again. You probably shouldnâ€™t either.

Guess  Iâ€™ll go back to Spark R&D bindings.
review.name: Failed first day out.

name: Prime Connect Split Kit 2.0

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just bought and tried on, love the fit, can't comment on warmth just yet so will have to give a quick summary to date, quality is good, fit is good, Very stylish. I'll determine if it compares to my normal brand of Northface. As for now, I'm satisfied
review.name: Impressive

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the color. Product is of really good quality. I really like Marmot clothing!
review.name: Really like my new Men's Fordham Jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket is amazing! So comfy and warm. I love the pockets, button closures, and detachable hood. I'm 5'11" and 175 lbs with a 41.5-in chest and 31-in waist. I tried the MEDIUM, but it was just a pinch too tight around the chest and around the armpits. I was skeptical about upsizing to the LARGE as I worried it would billow out around my midsection and look sloppy. However, the waist synch pulls things in just enough to keep this looking good. Would be a 5-star item if it had fully taped seams and was 100% waterproof.
review.name: Love this jacket...wish it was truly waterproof!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Looks good.  Extra warm.  Iâ€™ve liked the Fordham jacket with every version Iâ€™ve seen. Glad I finally pulled the trigger on this oneâ€¦.

review.reviewBody: I travel thousands of miles for work every month. This product is an essential piece of equipment I have & it has helped me numerous times.  I love having it!
review.name: Great emergency device to have!

review.reviewBody: Goal Zero does not disappoint.  My 4-Runner wouldnâ€™t start with the portable jumper I had. Before replacing the battery , I decided to invest in the Goal Zero portable jumper. Fast forward a week later.  I attached my powered up Goal Zero jumper. My vehicle started right up on the first try!
review.name: Dependable Goal Zero Quality!

review.reviewBody: Bought on recommendation from a friend. It was a gift but I'm sure it's great. Quick delivery, no problems.
review.name: It was a gift but I'm sure it's great

review.reviewBody: Seems like it will work.  Have not had the need to use it yet but the size and power seem right.  Every Goal Zero product I have purchased in the past has been right so I am expecting no less from this one.
review.name: Seems Good

review.reviewBody: My best purchase!!!  This gadget should never be missing!!
review.name: The Best gadget!!!

review.reviewBody: Great little emergency package to travel with.  Performs as advertised.  Low vehicle battery, preventing vehicle from starting, is quickly brought to life by hooking this little beauty to the vehicle battery.  Iâ€™ve also used to recharge some lanterns.  Can serve multiple functions.  The included carrying case is great for keeping all attachments together.  Well worth the price!
review.name: Works as advertised!

review.reviewBody: I bought this as a gift for my son. He is a car enthusiastand also does lots of car work for friends. Always a handy tool to meep in the trunk or garage!
review.name: Perfect Gift!

review.reviewBody: Great little battery pack!  I was able to jump a V8 Ford F-150 with a failing battery, on a cold morning.  Surprisingly,  it worked better than hooking up with jumper cables to another V8 truck.  It did take a couple tries, but the pack kept working and got the truck started.  I charged it back up and will keep it in the vehicle in case it's needed again.
review.name: Worked on a V8 Truck!

review.reviewBody: I am a size 8 in US shoe size. The sizing chart says that a US size 8 is equivalent to a size 40 in EU sizing so that is what I ordered. review.reviewBody: These cycling shoes are phenomenal, really comfortable and I love the Boa closure. I?d highly recommend going to a store and trying on any cycling shoe though for size reference. review.reviewBody: I've had this bag since 2019, now over 5 years on it's still my everyday bag for laptop/work as well as light travel/carry-on or riding my bike around town. It's showing almost no signs of wear despite the regular use and I'm thrilled with it! The only small complaint I have that I've been dealing with since the beginning is the strange decision to recess the clips on the front flap so I can't actually grab them to snap them. I still find myself clawing at them from the sides and pushing sideways just to get enough purchase on them to provide resistance for the snap. Such a strange design. But, like I said, the durability and functionality of the bag in every other way overshadows that minor issue.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: I bough this bag for college in 2018. Little did I know I'd keep the bag this long or that it would become my personal travel companion. I frequently fly across the US for work (think an average of 30 flights per year) and this bag has never let me down. No matter how much I stuff it, it fits in the personal bag checker at my chosen airline and allows me multiple days of clothing and supplies. No other bag compares. When I need to replace it, I will purchase another. It is truly waterproof and stain resistant. The only thing that has broken or shown wear is a plastic buckle that has broken an inner snapping point. I think metal buckles would be an upgrade, however, I plan to attach one myself to repair my bag. It does get heavy when full (as to be expected).
review.name: Fits Frontier personal bag box

review.reviewBody:
Have had this bag for my three years in college. It's amazing! My first pro is the quality of material. It has yet to show any wear or tear. I thought that the plastic buckle clips might break after a lot of use but haven't to this day. The bag is great for a laptop, books, pens, cables, and a lot more. You can fit more in it than you think. 

I've also used the bag a lot of travel and if you have extra items that don't fit in the bag, the cover flap can be used to store those larger items securely. 

Only negative thought I have is, like many others have said, it's very difficult for the bag to remain upright freely. This is something you get used to over time as you simply lean it against a chair leg or wall, nothing serious. 

Overall, very satisfied with this bag and would recommend to anyone in school or constantly on the go for business.
review.name: Perfect Bag

review.reviewBody: I have had this pack since about 2015.  I have used it daily that entire time.  It is a perfect pack for what I use it for.  It holds my smaller work laptop and papers with nice pockets to hold water bottle, passport, business cards, and all my cords and earphones.  It is getting a little worn on the main pocket release snap but otherwise holding up very well.  It travels nice and is typically the only carry-on I bring when I check a bag.  It is getting close to my birthday (the big 49) and my wife is badgering me for some birthday ideas.  Since it was getting a little worn I was on this site looking for a replacement (that I really dont need) and saw that this pack is still a model.  I do not write reviews but since I saw it was still hear and I really like the product I thought I would take a few minutes to give it my endorsement.  I would 100% buy this again.
review.name: Finally wearing out after 8 years of daily use.

review.reviewBody: pockets pockets pockets, best backpack Iâ€™ve ever had. itâ€™s perfect for the traveler as well as the commuter. plenty of space for a laptop, books, charger, and all the small things without being clunky
review.name: pockets!

review.reviewBody: So far, I love the backpack. It's compact, lightweight, and the quality is exceptional. Plus, it offers plenty of compartments to accommodate all my needs.
review.name: Lightwait and Excellent Quality

review.reviewBody:
I've used this bag nearly everyday for the past seven years and it is just now getting broken in. 

It has been my go-to daily bag since getting it in college. Hauling laptop and books to classes, messenger bag for day-long cycling adventures around the city, personal-item airport travel bag, road trip "essentials" bag, and a daily bag for commuting to-and-from work. I've used the bag in so many ways without any issues with zippers, material/fabric, velcro, buckles or straps. It's remarkable that the bag is just now beginning to look like it has been well loved.

I'm a sucker for purchasing new bags for my gear closet, but this one is so versatile and such a great UX I can't come to terms to replace it as my daily bag.
review.name: Sevens Years Strong

review.reviewBody:
I was looking for a backpack that would look sleek for work and that could work out as a 2-3 day trip backpack. After looking all around and ordering backpacks from other places, I finally found the one with the Subterra.
 
Pros:
- Good quality material
- Super comfortable, the back is super padded which is amazing
- Lots of pockets which was something I was looking for
- Easy access back pocket which was been super useful in the subway to get my Kindle out or to quickly get your laptop out 
- Design. I love that it looks pretty thin and sleek if you donâ€™t put many things on it (for work). Other backpacks would keep a bulky structure even if they were basically empty
- Big opening zipper is great for packing it up for travel
- Pretty expandable and big of you really fill it up (I think it is more than 25 L)

Cons
- Iâ€™ve realized it is sometimes hard to buckle it while closing.
- It only has one outer pocket (i.e. you need to unbuckle it to reach all the other pockets). Would be great if the Velcro flap in the front could be used without having to unbuckle the top.
- As mentioned in other reviews, the outer pocket opens to the outside, which in certain positions feels as if the inside could fall. Never happened to me but I understand it could.

I think the pros definitely outweigh the cons given the research
review.name: Great backpack for work and short trips

review.reviewBody:
I won this bag about 8 years ago and debating whether to find a different bag or continue using this one. A few improvements would make this even better. A strap on the bag to slide onto your carryon handle. More carabiner loops. Color options. The sunglass â€œpocketâ€ zipper is still stubborn. 
I use this bag strictly for traveling with my laptop, purse items and a few items of clothing and/or pair of shoes. I can stuff it pretty full.
review.name: 8 yrs and still going strong

review.reviewBody: This backpack is so wonderfully designed for people who like pockets and organization. Nothing on the market compares.  Mine is over a decade old too and still in the good use. The only thing is the side mesh pocket for a water bottle has torn. But thatâ€™s normal wear and tear, I believe. I would buy it again.
review.name: Best money ever spent on a backpack

name: Subterra 25L Backpack

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Tested out the Sirrus 36 for the first time in the Moosehead Lake Region in Maine. This pack is great for any type of hike from a short day hike to a long trek and beyond. It's very comfortable and sits well on the shoulders. The weight distribution is great and it is very easy to adjust as you're moving. It is very easy to secure your trekking poles and you'll be checking to see if they fell out because you don't notice them - don't worry, they're still there. 

Absolutely great pack for all types of hiking and treks. However, this pack truly shines on moderate-hard trails that require some climbing and meneuvering. You have to try it.
review.name: Tested out the Sirrus 36

review.reviewBody: I had an older SIrrus 36 pack that was sized, rather than one-size-adjustable. I LOVED that pack and wore it out. Very comfortable, fit great. I wanted to love this pack. I am tall but have a short torso, so I have to adjust the pack for a shorter back. That leaves the top of the pack riding too high on my neck. I can't comfortably wear a brimmed hat with the pack (I look up and the hat gets knocked down into my eyes, which is not comfortable or safe). Ones size fits all doesn't work for people at the shorter end of the size range. PLEASE bring back the excellent SIZED Sirrus packs you used to have. It was a great product.
review.name: One size fits all doesn't really work if you have a short to

review.itemreviewed: Bull Run Moc Toe Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Nice boots. True to size with minimal break-in time.
Use for light day hiking in dry conditions.(not waterproof).
review.name: Very nice boots

review.itemreviewed: Bull Run Moc Toe Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I would say these are very true to size . I was pleasantly surprised with them . They look fantastic with skinny jeans and leggings . Great ankle support as well . Love that it comes with two different colored laces. Red and brown laces â€¦.
review.name: Excellent comfort

review.itemreviewed: Bull Run Moc Toe Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I did my homework before purchasing these boots and despite the not so stellar reviews left here I went ahead with them. I DO NOT regret my purchase at all! 

The break-in period was about a week or so. They are leather boots so they are going to be stiff right out of the box. Be prepared to wear some good quality crew socks with them to prevent rubbing. I wear Darn Tough socks with them and they are a perfect match. I also wear skinny jeans tucked into the boots.

As far as sizing goes, I went to the Danner website and used their online sizing tool. I ordered a 6.5 which is my usual boot size. Just to give you an idea, I wear a 6.5 in Twisted X Driving Mocs as well as Nike Metcons and I wear a 7 in Brooks running shoes. I would say the Danners are true to size. 

 I have had them almost a month now and I have oiled them up once to soften them a little.  They are broke in pretty well and fit my feet wonderfully. I wear them daily. I work in an office but I walk a good bit during the day too. I have stood for long periods of time on concrete floors and never had any foot or back pain. These boots are comfortable all day long. I was dealing with foot pain before but I have not had any issues since switching to the Danners. I love them so much I even wore them in our fall family pictures. 

Backcountry had the best pricing on these boots as well! Standard shipping was also very quick.
review.name: My New Favorite Boots!

review.itemreviewed: Bull Run Moc Toe Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I alway wear a size 7.5. Ordered a 7.5 and they were too tight! Also run very narrow. The heal part was very uncomfortable. Very stiff boot over all. I have returned them.
review.name: Size not accurate

review.itemreviewed: Bull Run Moc Toe Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought these because they said they were steel toe and they looked super cute. Wrong. They are not steel toe or even composite toe. I wear an 8.5 ordered a 9 they feel like a 7.5!!! They also are very narrow and I don?t have wide feet. Im really disappointed that they didn?t work out. Because I do love they way they look.
review.name: Runs really small not steel toe

name: Bull Run Moc Toe Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: The other reviews are accurate. These are incredibly small. You can't even order your normal cycling glove size because these just aren't that. Perhaps these should be in the child cycling category because I think a size Small would fit my 4 year old niece.
review.name: SMALL is an understatement

review.reviewBody: Not much to say except I wear a small womens bike glove but these small womens gloves fit 2 or 3 fingers into it, no possible way to get it on.

review.reviewBody: Just saying these are small is not accurate. They are physically impossible to get on because the wrists are not very stretchy and they have no opening mechanism like Velcro, they are just a band. I have very small hands. I got the medium due to the "small" reviews - and while I can get them on I am afraid I would have to cut them off after riding. Think about putting on something the circumference of your wrist, but having to get it over your hand first. That is how this glove is designed, impossible to get on if you can't fold your hand into it.  They did not think this one through - I would give it 0 stars if I could.
review.name: Impossible to get on, really crap design

review.reviewBody: This is meant for a very very small child or midget. Maybe a dwarf.
review.name: Extremely small

review.reviewBody: Glove runs extremely small.  Upon inspection it looked like it fits a small child.  Did not want to go through hassle of returning and gave it away to a friend.  For reference, she is 4'11", small, thin hands; and even she had some trouble slipping it on.
review.name: Xnetic Road Glove - Women's

review.reviewBody: Good quality, minimalist design, but runs VERY small. I have small hands for a woman, and I cannot even pull these past my fingers. Quite honest they look sized for a small child.

review.reviewBody: my favorite shoe for all around performance, rubber is thick enough to provide support on small feet and, is real sticky! great heal and toe box on this shoe. This is my fifth pair of instincts, a perfect shoe really great fit.
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody:
I made the switch from my old leather Vapor Vs to the Instinct VSR in the same size. They were an amazing upgrade. The softer rubber on the VSRs sticks like glue and the sensitivity is unreal. It has great smearing capabilities for having such an aggressive downturn. The heel is snug but not painful.  Whereas, the heel in my old Vapor Vs had quite a bit of slop (the newest Vapor V's have an improved heel.) I'm now more confident in my heel hooks. Very little break in stretch, but the shoe has become easier to put on (maybe the layer of chalk helps.) The shoe has great power to the toe.

 The only place this shoe does not give me confidence is on micro edges. I do not feel locked in and feel more as though I'm smearing on tiny edges. Good thing they make the same shoe with an edging rubber outsole, the Instinct VS.

All around outstanding performance, comfort, and style for people with feet on the wider side.
review.name: Solid all around climbing shoe.

name: Instinct VSR Climbing Shoe
Scarpa Instinct VSR Climbing Shoe | GH Review

hasVariant.description: Buy the Silca Side Lever Locking Disc Chuck online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I've had this for four years and it's the best. It has even outlived the Silca Super Pista pump I bought it for (it turns out that they don't last forever). I replaced that pump with a Lezyne floor pump but I've transferred this to chuck to the new pump. Just screwed it into the schrader connector and voila!

Oh, I bought this because I was inflating my back tire to 100psi and the default Silca chuck didn't work at that pressure (they don't tell you that, of course). This chuck, however, worked every time. I've dropped down to 90psi four years later and it's still working flawlessly.
review.name: It Just Works

review.reviewBody: I've been using this tire on 27.5+ for years and it's been great for everything. I recently switched my wheel to 29" and bought this tire in the 2.4" size as that's all that will fit. Unfortunately the tread isn't as big/chunky as the plus size tires so while it's still a fast rear tire it doesn't grip as well in wet conditions. It's more likely to slide out in mud and wet roots so I'd consider something more aggressive for wet riding.
review.name: Fast roller for dry conditions

review.reviewBody: Bought this tire in hopes of it lasting a moderate amount of time. Walls are too thin and the third ride side walls couldnâ€™t handle a small rock and exploded on the sides.
review.name: 3 Trail Tire

review.reviewBody: Doesn't measure as a 2.4 and has significantly less volume than the 2.6 Rekon (or even the 2.3 Aggressor or 2.4 Dissector.)
review.name: Not a true 2.4

review.reviewBody: Works great in the dry and loose stuff here in Arizona, absolutely one of the best tires of i have ever ridden. Doesn't seem to have the dead zones my previous ardent and ardent race tires had, these give you plenty of warning when you're near the limit.
review.name: Awesome Arizona Tire

review.reviewBody:
Light, responsive, fun, versatile. Everything you could want in a resort ski. Plus I really like the styling. I was in-between sizes and got the smaller size and I don't mind it at all. 

It's not a specialized ski, if you're looking for a heavier with more drive that is something else.
review.name: Love these

review.reviewBody: These skis are so much fun to ski all over the mountain. They are easy to turn, not too burly and leave smiles on my face every time I ski them. As a mostly Eastern US skier, these are my daily driver
review.name: Great All-Mountain Ski

review.reviewBody: Rented this ski in Winter Park, CO for five days where conditions were overall soft and powdery but also skied in some corn and hard pack.  Overall it was a really nice ski and was the first time I've skied on Dynastars.  Good all mountain ski even in the pumps and trees.  My only wish is they could weigh a little less.  Graphics are distinct but a little boring in my opinion.
review.name: Overall a Really Good Ski

review.reviewBody: 2 skiis in one! good on hard surface as well as soft. Could handle both long and short turns with speed. Holds the line and edges in speed. Even if the ski might be for the experience skiier. its a easy "turner"!!
review.name: a ski that could handle multiple tasks

review.reviewBody: Lighter than my older ice axes. Sharp spike for hard snow. Well balanced. Just the right length. Great for general mountaineering.
review.name: Lighter than my older ice

review.reviewBody: I love the ergonomics and it functions well in steep snow (used up to 65Â°) i have two for added security and steep climbs, good weight to functionality
review.name: Great affordable beginner axe

review.reviewBody: Used on one practice session of self-arresting and self-belaying. Seems to be very well made, super light, totally sufficient for a basic piece of safety gear in mountaineering.
review.name: Great, cheap-ish, reliable

review.reviewBody: Great for basic glacier travel and self arresting. Limited on steeper terrain but can still get the job done on shorter steeper sections.
review.name: Great all around ice axe

review.reviewBody: Great piece of equipment for all the bigger mountain ski adventures when snow conditions can be dicey and variable. I like the straight shaft Piolet design because you can use it in multiple ways.
review.name: Classic Ice Axe

review.reviewBody: I have really enjoyed my time with the raven. I have tested this to about everything it is designed to do from general mountaineering to building steps up steep ice, and used as a shovel in a pinch summer camping. It's built like a tank. I would say this is the ice axe for someone in steep terrain with deep snow or flatter hard pack/ice. Personally wish I would have spent the little extra for the pro model.
review.name: BD Raven

review.reviewBody: Its a basic ice axe. Strong, light, I've used it quite extensively for non ice axe things and it proved to be a useful peace of gear for a good price
review.name: Couldn't be happier

review.reviewBody: This is exactly how an ice axe should be. Great price too. Another quality piece of equipment by black diamond.
review.name: Solid Raven

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable to carry from the head. Easy to secure with carabiner, very sturdy when driving in. Couldn't ask for more!
review.name: Perfect general purpose axe

review.reviewBody: if you're looking to make donations this is a great tool for many tasks that I've encountered while farming, foraging, and trapping... while it may not be intentional, this tool is great for general purpose living and could improve the lives of many people with heavier, less efficient versions.. while it is irreparable without advanced technology it sure does last. maybe consider giving some to people who need them, I know I'm happy to have oneðŸ™‚
review.name: @blackdiamond

review.reviewBody: I gifted  this to a friend who loves purple and also enjoys being out in the sun but needs constant protection from it. She loves the hat especially because she was able to adjust the fit and it provides her excellent sun protection.  while also being stylish in her favorite color.
review.name: My friend loves it

review.reviewBody: Great hat! Great color! This is the second one that I have bought.
review.name: Great hat!

review.reviewBody: I just bought this hat, but have worn it a few times already.  I love the brim size which is wide but not over-done, with the back a bit wider to keep sun off the neck.  Perfect!  I got a small because most hats are too big for me.  This one was just right.  It's light-weight and breathable, great for summer hikes/walks.  I love the quality of the materials and the sale price made it all a perfect package!
review.name: Absolutely fit for purpose!

review.reviewBody:
I was very happy to see that this was offered in a small size since I have a small head and most hats are very sloppy. The hat fits me perfectly and is very comfortable to wear. No itchy spots or tags.

The hat provides excellent coverage and exceeded my expectation. I bought white, so it also remains cool.
review.name: Provides excellent coverage

review.reviewBody: I already own an older version of this hat and it is my favorite by far. Light weight with a good-sized brim to protect my face. It doesn't flip up nearly as much as some other hats in the wind. I have a large, female head and the L fits me great. Any one-size-fits-all hat it too small for me. I bought this to replace my older hat which has stains. I did return it because of the color and bought a lighter color.
review.name: great hat

review.reviewBody: i live in florida. we have strong sun light every day of the year until 6pm. i use this hat to cover my face and neck while walking or playing pickleball. canâ€™t wait to take it hiking on my next trip. good material. good fit. light weight. good size, i can see well using it, and foldable.
review.name: awesome sun hat

review.reviewBody: This is a beautiful color. It has excellent sun cover but is also waterproof for quite a bit of rain. Love it!
review.name: Great hat!!

review.reviewBody: I bought a sizeÂ large because some reviews suggested it can leave a mark around the head (which is common for me with other hats). It's a little big - only noticeable on windy days, but thankfully the neck string prevents it from flying away! It is a very straight brim (if that makes any sense) so I find it works really well when the sun is directly overhead, however, during the rest of the day you will get sun on your face (e.g., tip of nose, chin, mouth area), so you'll want to ensure you're wearing sunscreen. Happy I got this on clearance (lavendar colour) as I wouldn't be as impressed if I paid full price (due to the stiffness/straight brim that doesnt provide the full coverage I prefer in a sun hat).
review.name: Good for noon time/when sun is directly overhead

review.reviewBody: I've been searching for a long time for a sunhat that was breathable, cute, and stayed on my head. This fits the bill! Color is great, keeps my sunburn prone skin protected, and looks pretty darn good.
review.name: Form function

review.reviewBody: Love the broad brim. And good looking to!
review.name: Great sun hat

name: Oasis Sun Hat - Women's

review.itemreviewed: RC903 S-PHYRE Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable and nice looking shoes. True the size
review.name: Nice shoes

review.itemreviewed: RC903 S-PHYRE Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: First, if youâ€™re going to get one of these shoes, remember it has to be the Wide model because the Wide is almost true to size. Second, they make a big difference. Theyâ€™re very, very lightweight and definitely make a noticeable impact. Theyâ€™re really comfortable, and in my opinion, theyâ€™re excellent. Compared to the ones I had before, this has been a big upgrade.
review.name: Make a difference!

review.itemreviewed: RC903 S-PHYRE Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've purchased the wide version of Shimano's top end shoe for ages, and mostly had a very good, but snug, fit for my feet. This latest version is definitely narrower and I'm hoping they will stretch out over time. These feel like the regular version to me, even though they are clearly marked as the wide version. This is disappointing that they would change the fit like this,  and I hope they stretch out a bit over time.
review.name: Unsure of the way Shimano Shoes fit now

review.itemreviewed: RC903 S-PHYRE Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great cycling shoes and quick shipping from Backcouontry!
review.name: Shimana S-Phyre

review.itemreviewed: RC903 S-PHYRE Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I wear a 44 in almost all Shimano shoes but went with 44 Wide and they fit well.  Also tried a 45 but they were too long.  Hope this helps.
review.name: Shoes run Narrow

review.itemreviewed: RC903 S-PHYRE Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I went through a difficult, painful time with replacing my shoes.  I went through 2-3 pair trying to find shoes which were comfortable.  I experience pain after an hour or so on my bike.  I had to resort to a podiatrist for injections in one foot.  I finally read about these shoes with the wide toe box.  I was somewhat reluctant to buy shoes online but decided to try them.  I am so happy and relieved I did!  They are the most comfortable shoes Iâ€™ve ever worn for biking.  I am riding for hours with no pain.  They are pricey but well worth it.
review.name: Relief!

review.itemreviewed: RC903 S-PHYRE Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes about a month or so ago. Since the moment I put them on,  I love the fit. I have a wide toe box and somewhat narrow ankle and the sapphireâ€™s fit perfectly. The ankle retention is perfect. After trying most of the higher end brands (Sidi, Specialized, Giro, Lake), I would say that this so far are the best fitting shoes. The carbon sole is plenty stiff and doesnâ€™t cause me hot spots like the Sidi shots.
review.name: Perfect fit and high quality shoes

review.itemreviewed: RC903 S-PHYRE Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
These seem to be nice shoes and well made. For $450 they should be! Also for $450 I would expect the wide version to be available in half sizes. I tried the shoes on and walked around on the carpet. They felt a little large (long) with a little extra toe room but even this wide version was a bit narrow for me. No amount of tightening would stop the heel slip - a sign that the size is too large. If I went down a full size I know even the wide version would be too narrow. Maybe a half size smaller would fit, but it isnâ€™t offered. I purchased a size 41W, my street shoe size is 7.5. I donâ€™t feel that the Shimano size table is off, just too much of a compromise to offer only full sizes in cycling shoes that demand a precision fit.
They do feel comfortable when cinched tight, a good sign of a well made shoe. I canâ€™t comment on ride feel since Iâ€™m sending these back and not taking a chance on the full size smaller. Going back to a more familiar brand. 
My experience - cycling for 34 years. Iâ€™ve gone through quite a few high end shoes but these were my first try for Shimano.
review.name: Disappointing - Wides only in full size

review.reviewBody:
I've own 10+ Mondo Evo over the years. They are my go to cycling bibs for any occasion (road or mtb, race days, 100-mile events, social rides, etc).
The compression is great, they are durable, chamois is a good fit, and the mesh fabric is comfortable.
They are worth the price! 5 stars...

Then they changed...
I recently bought one of the new design (navy blue), with the different fabric. Although the chamois is comfortable, the new stretchy fabric on the legs does not provide the same level of compression and the legs ride up as you pedal. Only used a handful of times, because I'd rather use my old stretched out bibs.
review.name: Loved them... then the design changed!

review.reviewBody: I bought two of these, same size just different color, this blue one fit totally different and because there is no sticky tape on the legs it rolls up.  The other one did not have sticky tape on the leg but was the actually length stated so they stayed down, the blue was much shorter on the leg and rolled up at every stride. I was very disappointed as I really loved the blue color. Had to return them.
review.name: Not a great fit

name: Mondo Evo Bib Short - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] good rain jacket for the spring time. not too warm, though, so if you want to wear this in the winter, i'd recommend lots of layers underneath + size up. sleeves are also a bit long for me but not too bothersome.
review.name: good rain jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love that no rain goes thru, it fits perfectly and i don't feel too much weight on me even when i wear a sweater under it.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have always had Columbia rain jackets and they just never disappoint!
review.name: Great Item

review.reviewBody:
I wore this jacket in a light-ish rain for about 10 min. The fabric was wet and water DID NOT bead off the jacket. I did not get wet inside but there's no way I would trust this jacket on a rainy hike. In comparison, my last 2 rain jackets were Columbia "Wet Dry" series and they were amazing... Ahhhmazing. I could do hard labor in pouring rain for hours & nothing got through. My whole body soaked except where that jacket was. Sadly for some reason, when I tried to get a new Wet Dry jacket, they only came in a horrible black that looked like a trash bag, eww, vomit. So, this is disappointing because the "Hikebound" jacket was a nice price, pretty, fit well, had a hood that actually fit & covered my head.. If all you need is to stay dry from the car to the door, I guess this is your jacket. If you want to battle mother nature face to face? Keep shopping. Sad :( 
Dear Columbia... Please bring back more colors in Out Dry... My Tangerine one from 7 or 8 yrs ago needs to be retired.
review.name: Disappointed
comment: Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback! We will make sure this is passed along to the appropriate teams regarding opportunities for improvement on this product. Thank you for choosing Columbia!

review.reviewBody:
This just doesn't measure up to the older versions of this product. The fabric, and dual pockets of old has been replaced with a thinner fabric, open ring snaps, and as pictured - one pocket. Everything feels cheap (but it's not a cheap shirt).

But my real issue is the fabric. The smoke/stone is a non-starter. It is very thin and feels like it won't hold up, and also has a fuzzy/shiny sheen that sheds on anything you would wear over or under this. I tried this on over a dark t-shirt and had to either wash, or run a fabric roller over it. So if you can stand how terrible the plaids look, perhaps that is a better fabric. For this price, this is a non-starter.

On fit - I would say it's generally true to size. I wear a medium in a lot of brands, Patagonia for one reference. If you are a medium in that, the medium will be good. It is fitted, so if you are wide or have a barrel chest, size up. But it's no more fitted than the older versions of this product.
review.name: Nice fit, terrible smoke/stone fabric

review.reviewBody: I really want to love these, but there's a couple things holding them back. The toe box is pretty narrow. Rubbing both sides of the ball of my foot and my toes. I could live with it, but it is uncomfortable. The biggest problem though, is the strap over top of the ankle. It is WAY to long. I ordered the right size by length, and, to strap them even slightly snug, there is barely a quarter of an inch of active velcro. The reasons I want to love them? The upper is super soft and comfortable, and the foot bed feels very good. But I like my shoes to be secure underfoot, and not be able to move all about on a whim. The upper strap just doesn't allow for that, unfortunately.
review.name: Wish I could love them

review.reviewBody: I needed a water shoe that offered good rock protection and didn't let small rocks in. I thought these shoes were the perfect option until I wore them for a few hours. It did what I wanted it to do but the plastic strap ring near the heal cut into my foot over a few hours, on both feet actually. It was extremely painful and I returned them immediately. This shoe needs a redesign where there's no hard plastic rubbing against the ankle and it would be the perfect water shoe.
review.name: Heel ring cut into skin!!

review.reviewBody: This is a well made thought out water shoe that works well.
review.name: Well made

review.reviewBody: saw a number of mixed reviews had to write one up after having these shoes for more than 6 months live in Lousiana where we go to the gulf area in mississippi. The beaches are really muddy and wanted a shoe that was a hybrid sandal that I could go into the water. These shoes took some time but I now really like them - the things was that I needed to develop calluses on my foot before the shoes became comfortable enough to walk all day around in - this took less than a month before i could walk around with out my skin rubbing against the shoe. I would first wear them loosely then eventually tighten them up. i went to California for some hiking and swimming they were great there , went to gulf area in Mississippi where it is muddy - true the sand does get into the shoes but one just needs to wash the shoes out really thoroughly, then you are ready to go. my area floods when there are thunderstorms - these shoes are great while walking in those conditions.
review.name: took awhile but really like these shoes

review.reviewBody: These shoes were terrible. Can't believe Teva would stoop so low.
review.name: Terrible fit

review.reviewBody: They are awesomely comfortable!!! What more do you want in a shoe?!? Way to go Teva!
review.name: Outflow Universal

review.reviewBody: I wear these to work because of a medical condition. I'm wearing sandals disguised as closed toe shoes. They are great.
review.name: Great sandals!!

review.reviewBody: Front plastic strap connection on each shoe. Has a small pocket between fabric and plastic for river stuff to enter and stay. Painful and you have to remove shoe constantly to clean out. I would not purchase again!
review.name: Poor Design

review.reviewBody: Velcro on straps is not long enough to tighten straps sufficiently Material in the heal of shoe needs some kind of soft padding, it's giving me blisters @ the back of my ankle
review.name: Water Shied

review.reviewBody: I see all these less than perfect reviews, and as usual wonder what people are thinking. I've worn Teva's for more years than I can remember, and I feel they are the best sandals out there for outdoor activities - or just general wear for that matter. These shoes are no exception. Very adjustable, super comfortable, keep the sand and stones out, and keep the tops of my feet from getting sunburned on long canoe rides. These were made for outdoor activities involving water. Sized correctly and would buy again.
review.name: Best Teva's yet

name: Outflow Universal Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the Specialized RIME 2.0 Mountain Bike Shoe online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: RIME 2.0 Mountain Bike Shoe
hasVariant.description: Buy the Specialized RIME 2.0 Mountain Bike Shoe online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These fit great, but combining the laces with the boa is somewhat redundant and cumbersome.  The shoes are hard to get on unless you completely loosen the laces and boa, and then the point of the boa is seemingly only to hold the laces down unless you want to crank down the top of the foot and cut off your circulation.  I just think this design is a miss.  Returned these and went with a full boa shoe.
review.name: Great fit - Annoying closure

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes. They are stiff for pedaling efficiency (especially for my platformless eggbeater pedals) and have great traction for navigating rocky hike-a-bike sections. Most importantly, these fit my wide feet well. I have worn them for daylong rides with no problems whatsoever. I found the shoes to be more waterproof than anything I've worn before. This is generally a good thing to keep your feet dry but I'd be wary about wearing them for a long ride that involves many river crossings as they don't appear to drain well. Overall, these are the best shoes I've worn in terms of fit and performance in the 15 years I've ridden a mountain bike.
review.name: Best mtb shoe I've found

review.reviewBody: I love Specialized products and was stoked to get these Rime 2.0 shoes on and riding.  They look great and are clearly well made with best materials.  The fit length is as expected, but these are definitely more narrow than typical MTB shoes.  I expect many road shoes to be narrow, but was disappointed that these are as well.  My feet were killing me after 20 miles and I had to cut the ride short.  If you have narrow B width feet, you might love these shoes.  If you are a D width, they will be too narrow.
review.name: Great looking shoe, but very narrow fit

review.reviewBody: I purchased a pair for myself and my son and have found these provide a nice balance between a stiff bike shoe, yet allows excellent walkability.  This is a great shoe if you have to climb over obstacles like tree trunks and rocks.  The soles are very positive for walking and that is a big plus.  If you need a shoe that delivers maximum power this is not that shoe, but between fit and comfort this shoe is excellent. This is a biking shoe you don't have to take off right after you finish and change into something else.  If I know I am going to not have to walk a lot during my ride I'll wear my Recon 3.0's since they are stiffer, but for a lot of rides where we have to get off and walk this is a great shoe.
review.name: Reasonably stiff yet walkable

review.reviewBody: Wore these twice on a 90 minute, 10 mile mountain bike ride. Even before the ride I noticed they were hard to lace-up due to the location of the strap. After about 45 minutes into the ride I started to have some discomfort around my ankle which continued to get worse. Since it was my first time wearing them I just figured they needed to break-in a little. The next day I spent a little more time adjusting the fit with the laces, but that didn't help. Pretty uncomfortable the whole ride. Started thinking maybe I needed different socks, but I've had no problems with my other riding shoes. So I returned them
review.name: Poor Fit, Hard to Lace

name: RIME 2.0 Mountain Bike Shoe
