review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Pro IN Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is the warmest jacket I have ever owned. With so many pockets, zippers, and straps, this is a must have for most anyone trying to brave the cold as anything over 40 Fahrenheit is too warm for me to wear this jacket. I am 5â€™10â€, with average build and ordered a large and it has enough room for warm winter clothes underneath without feeling constricted. I have purchased 3 jackets from Mammut and this is my favorite. Feels like wearing a warm fluffy hug that can handle any elements.
review.name: You get what you pay for with Mammut

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Pro IN Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
While the aesthetics, weight and warmth of the product are impressive, the outer shell is unnecessarily delicate. Within one week of wearing the jacket, it was cut open by a relatively dull piece of fencing that I lightly brushed up against while opening it. I honestly don't know how this could be worn for any activities beyond walking outdoors - in clearance from anything remotely sharp.

While I wanted to love the jacket, neither the manufacturer nor Backcountry was able to assist me with a replacement product. The outer shell's material is also so thin that a simple sew job would cause more damage to the product, than provide a solution to the original tear.
review.name: Warm, but terribly fragile

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Pro IN Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Amazingly warm and well made jacket!! Comfortable material on the cuff, convenient pockets, stuffs down reasonably given the size/warmth.

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Pro IN Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: warmest , little heavier than patagonia fritz one but more technical.. kept me war in this ski season
review.name: Warm - no extra layer needed

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Pro IN Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: No real problems with it.  There are probably warmer options out there with higher fill, but this one is great down in the negatives or above tree line with serious wind chill.
review.name: Great belay jacket

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Pro IN Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I recently had a similar (but 10 years older) puffy stolen which needed to be replaced for frigid morning walks with the dogs. I took them out for about 45 minutes at -5Â¬âˆžF with a light cotton long-sleeve on under this; I was getting hot when I was in the sun!

I see this as a wonderful belay/ski race parent/dog walking jacket, really anything that forces you to be pretty stationary in temperatures at or below 0Â¬âˆžF. It was a godsend after the New Year's polar plunge. 

I would likely use this for active pursuits under -15Â¬âˆžF, maybe -20Â¬âˆžF. It's pretty bulky, but not really when you consider the extreme warmth it brings.
review.name: Overkill? Nah.

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Pro IN Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I feel like a walrus wrapped in blubber. This thing is warm. I have packed it in my backcountry ski bag and it fits but is a little bulky. For me it's fine as I'm not hyper focused on shaving weight and/or bulk because my tours aren't usually incredibly long. Ultimately this jacket is very warm. I'm 5'11" and about 165 pounds and went with a medium. I am usually a medium with most upper body clothing and this fits pretty spot on but maybe a shade tight if you layer a lot underneath which probably you don't have to since this is so warm.

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Pro IN Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: In below zero Temps with a midlayer and sweater underneath I kept very warm and at times was sweating underneath. Quality materials and a must add to any arsenal. Also layers well under my mammut hardshell.
review.name: Exceptional Puffy Built For the Winter

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Pro IN Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought this because I was looking for a great belay puffy for ice climbing in Kyrgyzstan. It was super warm and cozy, packs down really well into sack it comes with. Has loads of pockets so perfect for taking it up a wall. Def too warm if not used in a cold environment or mountain so I probably wouldn't get it for city use. Highly recommended for the price, fit, usability, and warmth. Only regret is getting the orange color. Color is great for the mountains but very bright for daily use. I will wear it anywhere but definitely high viz energy lol
review.name: Super Warm Puffy Great for Mountain Adventure

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Pro IN Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I'm an admitted jacket junkie....this parka is a serious unit, super warm, plenty of well placed pockets. Hood is generous. I have several 800 fill parkas, the fit and finish of this one seems higher than my brands.
Super warm...I have warn it several times in 0 degree weather and below...kept me toasty. I'm 6'1, 195, bought a Large but probably should have gone XL to allow for layering.
review.name: Top quality Parka

name: Eigerjoch Pro IN Hooded Jacket - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Specialized Pathfinder Pro 2Bliss Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Put the Pathfinder Pros in 47 on my Stigmata for The WYO 131 gravel race.  This route is 131 miles long with 10K of climbing.  A probably 20 miles of pavement and a combination of smooth fast gravel and some chunky hard climbs.  These tires seemed fast and surprisingly stable in the softer stuff.  I liked the smooth strip for the pavement but the side lugs gave great holding power in gravel corners.  47 width gave a smooth ride.  I am sticking with these tires.
review.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro

review.reviewBody: Versatile, rugged tire good for both pavement and gravel.  They wear well and appear to have good puncture resistance. I had them in 700 x 38 and upgraded to 700 x 42 to handle some more rugged terrain. They did great on both packed and loose gravel.
review.name: Good for both pavement and gravel

review.reviewBody: Big fan. There are a lot of good online reviews and videos and these tires are in fact awesome. Soft, grippy, yet still fast. I hope they never discontinue them.
review.name: As good as they say

review.reviewBody:
Just swapped out Pathfinder Pro after 1,500 miles for the S-works version.

Raced on a set of Pro tires a few times this Spring with no issues and put over 1k miles of training rides on them.  The Pro on the rear got a small slice right on the smooth center section that would sadly never completely seal.  Got tired of refilling sealant and wiping off sealant from frame and the back of my jersey after rides. 

Typical training rides are rugged and over sections with large sharp rock so not surprised the rear tire only lasted 1,500 miles. Letâ€™sâ€™ see how the S-Works version compares!
review.name: Got 1,500 miles out of the Pro

review.reviewBody: I have tried many gravel / mixed surface tires over the years, from Panaracer to Maxxis and WTB. These are by FAR my favorite. The sidewalls seem less prone to cuts that other tires, the roll fast on the road, and they have just enough tread in unpaved roads. That includes hard pack gravel, loose gravel, sand, and dirt. I have 1,200 miles on my current 38s and just bought 42s for when the 38s are done.
review.name: Favorite Gravel/Groad Tires!

review.reviewBody: I purchased this a few weeks ago and it's been working out great.
review.name: Nice Rolling Tire

review.reviewBody:
I've now ridden all three sizes of the Pathfinder Pro â€“ 700*42, 700*38, and, most recently, 700*32.  They all roll really fast and I have never flatted on them.  I've ridden them tubeless and with tubes, mostly for training but also for events and races.  I currently have wheels with the 42's and a matching set with the 32's and I swap them regularly.  The 42's are wide and can really go anywhere â€“ they're just enough bigger than the 38's to make it worth putting them on for extra assurance in rougher gravel and singletrack.  I most recently rode the 700*42's at the Vermont Overland without any problems â€“ they handled the class 4 roads with relative ease. They're fast on roads and reassuring on trails. They inflate to 42mm wide exactly on "gravel-specific" rims and have not gotten wider after a year of riding them.  

The 700*32: Wow â€“ these are awesome!  I got them as soon as they were released and they are perfect for that sweet-spot of mixed road riding and lighter dirt roads and gravel trails.  They feel a lot faster than the 42's, which I really like for rides when I'm mixing paved and dirt roads or when I'm riding a lot of paved to get to dirt roads.  While the 38's and 42's are close to each other, the 32's feel much faster on the road and on trail.  I think the quickness comes from them being noticeably lighter and maybe more aero. It's enough of a difference to make swapping wheels worthwhile. They inflate to 32mm on gravel rims after a few months of riding them, making them perfect for cyclocross frames, too.  I think that all sizes of tire are one of the best value out there, too.
review.name: The Best Gravel Tires I've Ridden

review.reviewBody:
I used these (size 38 on 700s) on a bike packing trip this past week through Michigan.  90% road, 10% gravel and single track.  These tires worked extremely well.  Zero flats even using various pressures on my 65-70lb loaded bike.  

Unnoticeable resistance on pavement.  I kept up with others on urban tires without any issue. When we hit sand or small gravel patches, you could feel the tire slide slightly to the left or right before grabbing and keeping you upright, doing exactly what you would expect from this style tire.

I highly recommend these. If you are bike packing, I recommend going with the high viz models that they offer. Thatâ€™s the only change Iâ€™d make. I will be using these for BWR gravel race this October.
review.name: 500m through MI in 1 wk - No flats

review.reviewBody:
I ride primarily road with my Specialized Creo SL pedalec. The tire (38x700) is fast on the road and, because the streets in my neck of the woods are noted for their holes, cracks and rough roads, they are perfect for comfort, safety and speed. 
Taking turns fast is not an issue at all.
I ride them tubeless with sealant. 
When I first got my Creo SL I ordered road tires (28x700) but, by the time I received them, I decided these tires are what I prefer for my riding conditions. 
I just replaced the rear tire after 6500 miles with my front tire still showing the Specialized "S" being visible, so there's plenty of miles left in them. 
I highly recommend these tires if you mostly ride road.
review.name: 6500  miles and not one flat

review.reviewBody: I put the 700 x 42 on for BWR Asheville due to mix of gravel and road and couldn't have been happier with the performance.  Ran them tubeless at 38 rear and 36 front.  Really pleased.
review.name: Smooth rolling and puncture resistant

review.reviewBody: They are comfortable and lightweight, but I recently went OTB riding downhill and landed directly on my knee. This kneepad, when put on, was snug and tightened, but folded down completely when I crashed. I got a nice gash on my knee that should have been fully covered. I will be looking to replace these with something that fits higher on my thigh to avoid this in the future
review.name: Doesn't stay in place during crash

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a â€œtrailâ€ pad that would be comfortable to pedal in. I measured correctly and landed on a large, same as my Leatt pads. I liked the idea of Velcro to prevent any slippage. Unfortunately the Velcro is on a very elastic strap so it does next to nothing. When standing, the curve of the pad pushed the whole thing down my leg. I was also able to slide several fingers up under the lower edge of the pad. Returned as I wasnâ€™t confident they would stay in place. Itâ€™s possible that sizing down would help.
review.name: Weird fit

review.reviewBody: I bought these cause the Marine Corps did a number on the knees. These are so comfortable and feel great on my knees. They form to your knees and mold to a good fit. I am glad I got them to save what knees I have left! ja ja ja ja OORAH
review.name: Fits nice

review.reviewBody: very well made and it fits well. Highly recommend.
review.name: Excellent pads

review.reviewBody:
I have a few pairs, but they're great for every day riding. I took a pretty bad fall on some Sedona rock, and these definitely saved my knee from a pretty big hit. 

I love how they form around your knee, and they're convenient to wear around the ankle on a climb (you can also wear them on your knees as you climb, it's just hot out in the summer).
review.name: Love these kneepads

review.reviewBody: I had high expectations of these pads given the glowing reviews. I was looking to replace a set of Fox enduro pads which I'd worn for a couple seasons, and which were beginning to stretch out. These POCs look decent and have good protection (they are much more protective than my old Fox pads, and while you wouldn't want to use them for DH, they are perfectly adequate for most enduro or trail style riding). I do find the fit a bit funky while riding. They slide on very well and fit fine when standing, but while I'm pedaling I find them to be a bit abrasive and "pinchy." As a result, they are less comfortable for medium to long term rides than my old Fox pads, and in fact I can't wear them for multiple days in a row without getting abrasions that I have to let heal before riding again. Hopefully this will change after a few more rides and washes.
review.name: Wanted to love them

review.reviewBody: These Salomon Elixir hiking shoes are incredibly comfortable and durable. After several long treks, Iâ€™m amazed by their performance and support. A true game-changer for outdoor enthusiasts like me. Thank you, Salomon, for this outstanding product!
review.name: The Perfect Companion for Long Hikes

review.reviewBody: I really liked the look of this shoe. I need a utility shoe for light hiking, schlepping kids and equipment to/from ski racing, etc. I ordered the same 11.5 as I wear in EVERY OTHER Salomon product (classic and skate Nordic boots, a dozen pairs of running shoes over the last decadeâ€¦and the last just is not the same. These shoes are shorter and narrower/lower volume than every other Salomon product Iâ€™ve ever owned. Unfortunately, I hoped they would pack out or stretch a little or something, so I went ahead and wore them. But I sure wish I had swapped them for a 12. :(
review.name: I want to like theseâ€¦
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: Iâ€™ve only put about 30 miles on these, and theyâ€™re truly fantastic. Very durable under heavy weight and super lightweight at the same time. They were great out of the box. I just wish they came in wides :/
review.name: absolute unit of a hiking shoe

review.reviewBody: I was skeptical because reviews were very mixed on these.. but I ended up loving them. I have a hard to fit foot and supinate (walk on the outside of my feet) so finding a shoe that works is tough. I work in research and new product development at a plant nursery, so I needed a good water proof  shoe that was comfortable for long hours in the fields and green houses. These definitely fit the bill. I find myself picking these to wear more then any thing else.
review.name: Really love these

review.reviewBody: I'm mail carrier walking 35,000 steps daily Monday to Friday, look for good thickness cushion for my feet health and good sole traction for fall/spring. Little too big but not big deal and I will get half
review.name: Thickness cushion and traction

review.reviewBody: Felt like slippers. No breaking in period. Highly recommended
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: Right out of the box great shoe, little to no breaking in. Comfortable. Only complaint is a little snug on my right Achilles.
review.name: Great Shoe

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing Salomonâ€™s for over 25 years, one of my favorite brands. Comfortable fit and light, breathable and waterproof. This pair I bought through the website without trying them on. Mistake. My feet were uncomfortably hot, and for the first time my socks and the insoles had a sour smell after walking. I had to remove the insoles after each use and hand wash them. Not convenient while traveling abroad. I would not recommend this shoe for weather above freezing.
review.name: Too hot!
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of the same shoe type. I have bought it fearing that the older pair would give away after one year of use. Both are excellent. Comparing to other brands that I used before from other manufacturers, my sense is that Elixir Gore from Salomon is best.
review.name: Good for long walks

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable straight out of the box , 1st hike no blisters so far so good
review.name: Very happy with my purchase
